questions.questionText: Which of the following is not a keyword in java?
questions.explanation: Exception is a class in Java not a keyword

options.text: class variables are variables defined inside methods, constructors or blocks.
class variables are variables within a class but outside any method.
class variables are static variables within a class but outside any method.

questions.explanation: static variables in Java are called Class variables as they have class scope and are common to all objects of class

questions.questionText: What is true about a final class?

options.text: class declard final is a final class.
Final classes are created so the methods implemented by that class cannot be overridden.

questions.explanation: All the options are true and explain a fact about final class

questions.questionText: Which of these keywords are used for the block to be examined for exceptions?
questions.explanation: try is used for the block that needs to checked for exceptions

questions.questionText: Which one of the following is not an access modifier?
questions.explanation: public, private, protected and default are the only access modifiers in Java, void is a keyword

options.text: It can have any non access modifiers
It can take any number of parameters

questions.explanation: Constructor can have any number of parameters

questions.questionText: What is not the use of “this” keyword in Java?

options.text: It is a reference variable that refers to the current object

questions.explanation: In Java this keyword refers to current class object

questions.questionText: Which of the following is a valid declaration of an object of class Box?
questions.explanation: Box obj = new Box(); is the right way

questions.questionText: Which of these is used to allocate memory for an object?
questions.explanation: new keyword helps to allocate memory for an object in heap
